info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 8:41PM MDT until June 09 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Glasgow affecting Valley County. For the Milk River...including Glasgow...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Glasgow. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Water begins to flow across 6th Ave SW also known as Aitken Road south of the Milk River Bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 28.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM MDT Sunday was 28.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Thursday morning and continue falling to 14.8 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.2 feet on 05/12/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Milk River Glasgow 25.0 28.5 Sun 8 pm MDT 27.0 25.3 26.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning by 845 AM MDT.
